question.title: Entitymodifiers runs but show no change

fragments.text: I'm making a board game and I'm stuck on problem that's been killing 3-4 hours for me now. No docs anywhere so I'm just doing guesswork without luck.

informationUnits.rawText: I'm making a board game and I'm stuck on problem that's been killing 3-4 hours for me now. No docs anywhere so I'm just doing guesswork without luck.

informationUnits.rawText: This code is supposed to draw a "highlight" rectangle for a particular block. The rectangle draws all right, but the AlphaModifier does not applicate its values on the entity in question. The DelayModifier works just fine.

elements.contents: This code is supposed to draw a "highlight" rectangle for a particular block. The rectangle draws all right, but the AlphaModifier does not applicate its values on the entity in question. The DelayModifier works just fine.

fragments.text: I added
just to see if it gets called, and it does; I see "Alpha start" and "Alpha stop" in Logcat. But the highlighted rectangle is still there, clearly visible on the board.

informationUnits.rawText: I added ModifierListener just to see if it gets called, and it does; I see "Alpha start" and "Alpha stop" in Logcat. But the highlighted rectangle is still there, clearly visible on the board.

elements.contents: I added ModifierListener just to see if it gets called, and it does; I see "Alpha start" and "Alpha stop" in Logcat. But the highlighted rectangle is still there, clearly visible on the board.

fragments.text: As a last resort I added a
as well to move the rectangle 50 pixels to the right during 5 seconds, and the rectangle was moved off screen instantaneous.

informationUnits.rawText: As a last resort I added a MoveModifier as well to move the rectangle 50 pixels to the right during 5 seconds, and the rectangle was moved off screen instantaneous.

elements.contents: As a last resort I added a MoveModifier as well to move the rectangle 50 pixels to the right during 5 seconds, and the rectangle was moved off screen instantaneous.

fragments.text: Why aren't these modifiers working as expected?

informationUnits.rawText: Why aren't these modifiers working as expected?

elements.contents: Why aren't these modifiers working as expected?

fragments.text: Have you tried using
)? You can also iterate over the entity manually using
and
. Or is there a reason you cannot do neither of these?

informationUnits.rawText: Have you tried using Entity.callOnChildren(IEntityCallable pEntityCallable)? You can also iterate over the entity manually using getChildCount() and getChild(int pIndex). Or is there a reason you cannot do neither of these?

node.contents: Have you tried using Entity.callOnChildren(IEntityCallable pEntityCallable)? You can also iterate over the entity manually using getChildCount() and getChild(int pIndex). Or is there a reason you cannot do neither of these?

fragments.text: Well, yes and no. Yes, it's solved if I use only one rectangle and don't nest rectangles into an Entity. No, it's not solved since I want a rectangle with a "hole" in it and I can only get it to work with one rectangle. Perhaps I will have to make a bitmap-sprite of it.

informationUnits.rawText: Well, yes and no. Yes, it's solved if I use only one rectangle and don't nest rectangles into an Entity. No, it's not solved since I want a rectangle with a "hole" in it and I can only get it to work with one rectangle. Perhaps I will have to make a bitmap-sprite of it.

node.contents: Well, yes and no. Yes, it's solved if I use only one rectangle and don't nest rectangles into an Entity. No, it's not solved since I want a rectangle with a "hole" in it and I can only get it to work with one rectangle. Perhaps I will have to make a bitmap-sprite of it.

fragments.text: If I only do one rectangle and attach that one to the scene (instead of the entity and then the entity to the scene), all works perfectly. So it seems that the Modifier won't apply to children. If there only were any docs telling me this before I wasted 10+ hours.

informationUnits.rawText: If I only do one rectangle and attach that one to the scene (instead of the entity and then the entity to the scene), all works perfectly. So it seems that the Modifier won't apply to children. If there only were any docs telling me this before I wasted 10+ hours.

node.contents: If I only do one rectangle and attach that one to the scene (instead of the entity and then the entity to the scene), all works perfectly. So it seems that the Modifier won't apply to children. If there only were any docs telling me this before I wasted 10+ hours.

fragments.text: Still not working :/ It is working if I do `
`, i.e. apply the Modifier to all subchildren. But according to the

book by Rick Rogers this should not be needed, since applying a Modifier on an entity parent will apply the same modifier to the children as well. However, when I apply anything on the parent nothing happens to the children.

informationUnits.rawText: Still not working :/ It is working if I do `for (int n = 0; n < e.getChildCount(); n++) { e.getChild(n).registerEntityModifier(sem); }`, i.e. apply the Modifier to all subchildren. But according to the AndEngine book by Rick Rogers this should not be needed, since applying a Modifier on an entity parent will apply the same modifier to the children as well. However, when I apply anything on the parent nothing happens to the children.

node.contents: Still not working :/ It is working if I do `for (int n = 0; n < e.getChildCount(); n++) { e.getChild(n).registerEntityModifier(sem); }`, i.e. apply the Modifier to all subchildren. But according to the AndEngine book by Rick Rogers this should not be needed, since applying a Modifier on an entity parent will apply the same modifier to the children as well. However, when I apply anything on the parent nothing happens to the children.

fragments.text: So you solved the problem?
You need to set the blend function, call .
on the entities.

informationUnits.rawText: You need to set the blend function, call .setBlendFunction(GL10.GL_SRC_ALPHA, GL10.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA); on the entities.
